title: Public referral form: visible non-blocking Website field (no honeypot logic)

requirements.summary: Add a visible, visually unobtrusive Website (leave blank) text input named `website` at the bottom of the public referral form.
acceptanceCriteria: The public referral form renders a visible text input with `id="website"` and label text exactly “Website (leave blank)”
The `website` input appears at the bottom of the form (after existing fields) and is visually unobtrusive while still readable/usable
No other honeypot/spam fields are present on this page

file_operations.description: Add a new controlled `website` text field to the public referral form UI using existing shadcn/ui `Label` + `Input`, labeled exactly “Website (leave blank)”, positioned after all existing fields and immediately above the submit button (or directly above the form’s footer area). Apply small/secondary Tailwind styling (e.g., smaller text and muted tone) so it remains visible but unobtrusive. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Ensure the new `website` field has no honeypot behavior and does not alter existing validation or submission/mutation flow.
acceptanceCriteria: Filling or not filling the `website` field does not change validation behavior or submission behavior
`handleSubmit` does not contain any conditional checks that branch on `website` content (no rejection/early return/skip-mutation logic based on `website`)
The referral creation mutation is still called on valid submissions regardless of `website` value
The `website` value is not required and does not create validation errors

file_operations.description: Keep `handleSubmit` and validation flow unchanged with respect to submission: do not add any conditional logic based on `website`, do not add trimming/validation checks for it, and do not include it in the `validateReferralForm` call or the `useCreateReferral`/mutation payload. The field should remain optional and purely UI-level. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
